effects: The Court Technology Improvement Act of 2009 (HB 1353, enacted as Act 328) authorizes the Arkansas Supreme Court, through the Administrative Office of the Courts, to design, purchase, implement and operate a comprehensive automated court management system.  The Act makes the system self‑supporting by requiring that all funding be generated through use of the system rather than general revenue and is known as the "Court Technology Improvement Act of 2009"【877678106644158†L67-L118】.  It amends statutes governing credit‑card payments and collection of fines to enable electronic payments and supports a fee structure that funds court technology improvements【877678106644158†L67-L118】.
